comments.body:
0 is a pretty terrible default (I think it's transparent? What does Android even do with that).

I think if we want to require a colour we should just assert when no colour is given. Since color is a required argument here, asserting non-null seems legit.

Can android be told to use a default value? If so maybe a better solution is to support that (e.g. by making it nullable).
~~As far as I can tell, our Java side throws when you pass 0.~~ Actually it special-cases 0. It throws (crashes) for transparent values other than 0 (e.g. 1 crashes).
